Articles.Content: I found it from a post on the FM forums.

I was playing on a game called Roblox, checking up on a group I'm in called the Roblox Space Administration, and some said they couldnt wait for KSP 0.16 to come out, and I asked him what KSP was. I tried the demo, and now I'm gonna buy it today
This particular thread on Reddit from way back in 0.7.
The Quick Look on Giantbomb.
searching with "Free flight simualator," I found v0.10 in brothersoft
I remember finding KSP when some of my aero engineering buddies started playing it
I first heard about ksp on rebel FM podcast of eat-sleep-game.com
I found out about it on the Shores of Hazeron forums. It was an earlier build where all you could do was see how far up you could go. Naturally it turned into a small competition.
Kurt J Mac!

The game got my attention by a comment from someone at this article: http://derstandard.at/1339639688318/Bauplaene-fuer-das-Leben-auf-dem-Mond

(I read a lot articles and news about astronomy, astrophysics & related stuff.. )
From Robug Labs on roblox, Robug and some friends were talkin bout it, Asked em bout it and been a member ever since.
i found orbiter and found ksp one day on youtube way back in .09

Instead of making a thread for this, I thought posting here would be apropos. Totalhalibut, aka Totalbiscuit, just gave KSP some attention by liking TheRealGiantBomb's video of a playthrough of KSP. You can see it here, it is mildly entertaining: http://youtu.be/6cVkLmVnsH8

Brace yourselves, there is going to be more coming to our rocket party!
Thoroughly inspired by Robbaz King of Sweden to drop by and pick up .15
Was subscribed to kurtjmac's Minecraft videos, and then decided to watch some of his KSP stuff.

i found ksp 3 ways...

1) i saw a review on this game back in 0.7 on tv

2) i forgot about this game until i saw kurtjmac

3) i looked at the game more and found trydyingtolive
The Mars Curiosity Reddit AMA.

Rock Paper Shotgun, back when .13 came out.

Actually they'd mentioned it before that, but the .13 article is what made me actually look at the site and get the demo.

It's been so long I honestly can't remember. I suspect it was via reddit as that's the only place I could have picked up on it.

Cheers!

Capt'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Someone in my Google+ stream pointed me at the Kerbal Space Program SomethingAwful thread, and I downloaded v. 0.8 soon afterwards.

Either reddit or g+ for me.

My initial post about KSP on another forum is from 2011-07-20, 16:30:07 - no Idea what Version was out back then
I was doing a science, and mis-typed K<sub>sp</sub>. (That is, equilibrium constant of the solubility product... yay, chemistry!)

I searched at google, raketenbauprogramm (rocketbuildprogram)

I found 0.11 on a download site. I downloaded it and i loved it!
SpaceBattle.com's KSP thread.
Facebook. My friend was posting a video on a single stage rocket ... and well .... let's just say I got interested.
